snippet: A convoy of Afghan officials was hit by a remote-controlled bomb before coming under small-arms fire for 15 minutes before the attackers escaped.
abstract: Taliban insurgents kill five Afghan education officials and wound three others during an ambush near the Pakistani border; officials were part of delegation visiting schools in Urgun, one of the largest districts in Paktika Province.

byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi contributed reporting from Kabul, and an employee of The New York Times from Khost Province, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: A convoy of Afghan officials was hit by a remote-controlled bomb before coming under small-arms fire for 15 minutes before the attackers escaped.

headline.seo: Taliban Kill 5 Education Officials in Ambush
headline.main: Taliban Kill 5 Afghan Education Officials Near Border
headline.print_headline: Taliban Kill Five Officials With Schools Near Border
